---
title: "NOAA Atlantic Hurricane"
author: "Andrew & Ben"
date: "2024-10-09"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# loading packages needed
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, skimr, broom, GGally, lubridate)

# Changing the default theme
theme_set(theme_bw())

# read in the data set
hurricanes <- read.csv("storms.csv") 
hurricanes <- hurricanes |>
  mutate(
    date = as.POSIXct(paste(month, day, year, hour), format = "%m %d %Y %H"),
    )
```


```{r exploratory data analysis}
summary(hurricanes)

# View the first few rows of the long-format data
head(hurricanes_long)
```

## IncludingPlots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
